de.rincewind.api.gui.elements

Interface ElementCounter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, ElementButton, ElementDisplayable, ElementSizeable, EventBased, Sizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftElementCounter, Elements.ElementCounterExtendable

    public interface ElementCounter
extends ElementButton
    With this element you can count
    Author:
    torben

      • MAXIMUM_COUNT

        static final int MINIMUM_COUNT

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        Returns the current count of this element.
        Returns:
        the current count of this element

      • getMaxCount

        int getMaxCount()
        Returns the maximal countable number of this element. The default is set to 10 (ElementDefaults.COUNTER_MAXIMUM).
        Returns:
        the maximal countable number of this element

      • getMinCount

        int getMinCount()
        Returns the minimal countable number of this element. The default is set to 1 (ElementDefaults.COUNTER_MINIMUM).
        Returns:
        the minimal countable number of this element

      • setMaxCount

        void setMaxCount(int maxCount)
        Sets the maximal countable number to this element. If the new count is greater than 64 the count will be set automaticly to 64.
        Parameters:
        maxCount - change to

      • setMinCount

        void setMinCount(int minCount)
        Sets the minimal countable number to this element. If the new count is smaller than 1 the count will be set automaticly to 1.
        Parameters:
        minCount - change to

      • setCount

        void setCount(int count)
        Sets the current displayed count. If the new count does not match the frame of minimal and maximal count, the new count will be adapted.
        Parameters:
        count - change to

      • increment

        void increment()
        Adds to the current count 1. To set the new count setCount(int) will be used.

      • countdown

        void countdown()
        Subtracts 1 of the current count. To set the new count setCount(int) will be used.

      • addIncrementer

        void addIncrementer(ElementButton btn,
                    int value)
        Adds to an ElementButton a listener to increment this element. The value to add by clicking the button can be specified. If the user shiftclicks the button, the value to add will multiplied by 2. You can also set the value to a number smaller than 0 to subtract counts from this element by clicking the button.
        Parameters:
        btn - add the listener to
        value - incremented by clicking
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the button is null

      • addIncrementer

        void addIncrementer(ElementButton btn,
                    int value,
                    Point point)
